1442.content:
Yomi was always monitoring her weight. But could you really blame the girl?

I mean, it's constantly being pushed in tabloids, advertising, all sorts of media that to be thin is to be truly attractive.
And, well, she bought into about 95% of it, and sometimes took fairly ridiculous measures to ensure that she would not become hefty and supposedly unnatractive as a result of being bigger.

But, all of this started to take a toll on her. Not just physically but, mentally as well. Sure, she was able to scrub off a few pounds, but there wasn't any huge difference apparent.

So, after some counseling, soul searching, and a few sleepless nights, she came to her conclusion.

"You know what? Screw it." she decides. "All of this nonsense about dieting and losing weight is ridiculous. If someone doesn't find me attractive for who I really am, that's their fault, not mine."

Armed with this new insight, she completely threw away her dieting regiment and resolved to eat what she wanted, whenever she wanted. Carbs be damned.

Pretty soon it wasn't an uncommon sight for her to be sneaking food during class or eating foods that were generally considered to be 'fatty' in public.

And, as expected, it was starting to have an effect. But, no one could have seen the effect it was having on Miss Yomi Mizuhara. She herself started to notice quite a difference one day, looking in her full-size mirror in her room.
